function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i <= 4' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i <= 4' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'j <= 4' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'j <= 4' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i <= 4' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j <= 4' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'i (line 4)' used after its definition?
Is variable 'j (line 4)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'i' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'j' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'for(i = 1; i <= 4; i++)' unreachable?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “if(i != j && i != k && j != k)”?
